explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since there are the descriptions that this product irritates to the eye, causes redness and pain (ICSC(J), 1993), it was classified into Category 2B.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization: no data available. Skin sensitization : it is described, "skin sensitization may be carried out by repetition or long-term contact " in ICSC(J) (1993) of the Priority 2 document, and it is not a deterministic conclusion (ATSDR, 2005; HSG, 1992) although skin sensitization may be shown to humans as an inorganic arsenic compound, in addition, it was presupposed that it cannot classify from the description in the humans of EHC 224 (2001) "development of the skin sensitization of inorganic arsenic is rare" since data is insufficient.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Without data. In addition, arsenic and inorganic arsenic compound are classified into the germ-cell mutagenicity category 3A (equivalent for GHS Category 1B-2) according to DFG (MAK/BAT, 2005).

carcinogenicity.hazard_statement: May cause cancer (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
carcinogenicity.rationale: Since arsenic and arsenic compound are categorized into the human carcinogens in IARC Suppl.7 (1987), ACGIH-TLV (2004), and MAK/BAT (2004), it was classified into Category 1A.

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There is no data of this product, but in ACGIH (7th, 2001), ATSDR (draft, 2005), EHC 224 (2001), and DFGOT vol.21 (2005) there was an opposite report. Since the reproductive and developmental toxicity knowledge by inorganic arsenic was indicated in laboratory animals, it was considered as category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (digestive system, cardiovascular system, nervous system, kidneys, liver, respiratory)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (digestive system, cardiovascular system, nervous system, kidneys, liver, respiratory)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 1 (gastrointestinal system, cardio-vascular system, nervous system, kidneys, liver, respiratory system,). Based on the reports that it affects the central nervous system, gastrointestinal tracts and circulatory system and may cause severe hemorrhage, body fluid and electrolyte losses, collapse and shock (ICSC (J) 1993), and that in the forms of the arsenic and inorganic arsenic compounds it causes "symptoms in the gastrointestinal organs, disorders in the functions of the cardio-vascular and nervous systems, myelosuppression, alteration in the blood system and nephropathy" in humans (EHC 224 (2001)), and that it affects the liver, upper airways and lungs (ACGIH (7th, 2001)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (digestive system, cardiovascular system, nervous system, kidneys, liver, blood system, skin, respiratory organs)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (digestive system, cardiovascular system, nervous system, kidneys, liver, blood system, skin, respiratory organs) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since this product affects the peripheral nervous system, the skin, mucosa, and liver, and neuropathy, pigment disorders, nasal septal perforation and cirrhosis may be occured (ICSC (J), 1993), and the description in human of EHC 224 (2001) about arsenic and inorganic arsenics compounds "the disorder of gastrointestinal tract, neuropathy, effect on blood systems, and abnormalities of a cardiovascular systems, the kidney, and liver were observed. Target organ are gastrointestinal,heart,brains and kidney. Skin,marrow and peripheral nerves were also affected " and in addition, based on the description of effect on the upper respiratory tract and lungs (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), it was classified into Category 1 (digestive tract, cardiovascular systems, nervous systems, kidney, liver, blood systems, skin, respiratory system).
